author: Beau Hayhoe
title: Best Body Lotions for Winter
text:
Beau Hayhoe January 5, 2024 Share Tweet Flip The AskMen editorial team thoroughly researches & reviews the best gear, services and staples for life. AskMen may get paid if you click a link in this article and buy a product or service.
When it comes to skincare, most men don't think much beyond summer sunscreens and aloe vera, but the truth is that the winter can wreak havoc on your skin. The extreme cold, dry air, and even sun exposure can all cause serious damage to the skin of your face and body, but bundling up under multiple layers of clothing can also cause problems, denying our skin fresh air or causing chaffing.
That's where the right body lotion can work wonders.
Think of body lotion like another layer of defense against the winter chill, with the ability to calm dry, chapped skin on your neck, hands or arms. Body lotions can also nourish and fortify your skin throughout the rest of the year, but it’s crucial and important to use it during times of the year when your skin is especially prone to excess dryness.
RELATED: 5 Common Skin Care Mistakes Men Make
Body lotion is also useful if you’ve got tattoos and want to give them some extra fortification (once they’re properly healed, that is). Above all else, body lotion is not to be overlooked. Add some to your grooming rotation right now with our 10 favorite picks, featured below in all their glory.
Best Lotions to Heal Dry Winter Skin Aesop Breathless We begin with a decidedly high-end option, but if you're in the market for a nourishing body lotion, you can't do much better than Breathless by Aesop. This botanically-based formula, enriched with nut oils and Vitamin E, heals and moisturizes dry skin like no other.
$37 at Aesop.com
Mad Rabbit Replenish Body Lotion If, on the other hand, you’d prefer lotion without fragrance, Mad Rabbit – a major player in the world of tattoo care – has a universal moisturizer sans a scented finish. This moisturizer works if you’re tatted up, but is also particularly useful even if you don’t have any ink. The key is a blend of butters and plant-derived ceramides to deliver non-greasy, fast-absorbing skin hydration.
$37 at MadRabbit.com
Dove for Men Ultra-Hydra Cream Dove for Men goes above and beyond with a thick, super-nourishing cream that offers up hours upon hours of hydration. It’s essential for especially dry skin types and areas prone to chapped skin during the winter, like your neck. It also works on your face and hands, so it’s really a 3-in-1 moisturizer that’s plenty useful, no matter the time of year.
$3.95 for 3 at Amazon.com
Hero Brave Body Deep Scrub
If you're focused more on repairing damaged skin rather than preventing future damage, pick up the Brave Body Deep Scrub from Hero Cosmetics. It may look small, but this tiny package packs a mighty punch: just one application per week will help visibly renew your damaged skin and better help your body face down the ravages of winter weather.
$10.49 at HeroCosmetics.us
Vaseline Men's Healing Hand and Body Lotion Target dry skin and hands with this dual-purpose, extra-strength lotion especially suited to dry skin. It absorbs in 15 seconds to lock in nourishment, and it doesn’t hurt that you’ve probably used Vaseline as a treatment for dry skin for years, too. Think of this as a new and improved body lotion for the modern man.
$17.69 for 3 at Amazon.com
Gold Bond Men’s Everyday Hydrating Lotion Like Vaseline, you’ve trusted Gold Bond powders for years, right? Extend that trust to a Shaq-approved hydrating lotion (seriously, it says so right on the body lotion) in a large size ideal for plenty of daily use. Seven moisturizers and three vitamins bolster the rich, nourishing quality of this thick cream, so get your bottle today.
$11.99 at Amazon.com
Old Spice Daily Hydration Lotion Shea butter powers this deeply hydrating body lotion, which gets a further boost from the bold amber scent (befitting an Old Spice product, no doubt). You can use it as a hand lotion, too, and you get the added benefit of being able to scoop it up in a highly useful four-pack from Amazon.
$27.25 for 4 at Amazon.com
Jack Black Cool Moisture Body Lotion Jack Black’s aptly named Body Lotion is designed to penetrate the skin and lock in next-level hydration, and the brand says it’s especially useful on your knees, elbows and feet. Seeing as those areas tend to get overlooked as part of a grooming routine, this body lotion could prove to be an essential addition to your daily rotation.
$32 at Amazon.com
Malin + Goetz Vitamin B5 Body Lotion Malin + Goetz has long been the standard in premium grooming for well-groomed guys, with an intensive approach that yields wonderful fragrances and products that perform even better than they look. This vitamin-packed lotion is no different, using bergamot and plenty of vitamins to lock in moisture quickly without that greasy feeling.
$74 at MalinandGoetz.com
Oars + Alps Body Lotion Oars & Alps stays winning when it comes to natural skincare, with an entire line of products approved and used by NFL star DeAndre Hopkins. The key to this body lotion is shea butter, but arnica and magnesium are also in the mix to reduce and relieve muscle soreness. It’s a one-of-a-kind body lotion fit for star athletes and your grooming routine.
$12 at OarsandAlps.com
You Might Also Dig:
Best Callus Removers Best Face Sunscreens for Men Best Skincare Products on Amazon

author: ERR News | ERR
title: Kallas: Ukraine's pathway to NATO is irreversible | News | ERR
text:
Speaking at the NATO-Ukraine Council in Washington, Kallas said that NATO and Ukraine are closer today than ever.
"Yesterday, we took important decisions to bring Ukraine even closer to the alliance," the Estonian PM said. "NATO will take a leading role in coordinating security assistance and training for Ukraine. Allies also pledged long-term financial support for Ukraine. These are very clear, practical preparations for the country's accession to NATO. Ukraine's rightful place is in the alliance, and its pathway to membership is irreversible."
Kallas also stressed that it should not be forgotten that Ukraine, for the third year running, is fighting for Europe and the free world as a whole.
"That is why we need to stay firm when it comes to increasing the cost of aggression," she said. "Helping Ukraine to victory will require additional effort from all allies. Estonia's military aid to the country amounts to more than 1.4 percent of our GDP, but we are continuing to look for new ways of supporting Ukraine. I encourage all of our allies to do the same."
The joint statement of the NATO-Ukraine Council was also adopted on Friday. G7 countries and all the partners who have signed security agreements with Ukraine also signed a Ukraine Compact. The purpose of the compact is to reaffirm that long-term support for Ukraine will continue until its victory.
--
Follow ERR News on Facebook and Twitter and never miss an update!
Editor: Michael Cole
nato ukraine ukraine war kaja kallas hommik anuga washington summit defense sepnding

author: @citi973
title: NDC slams Hawa Koomson over defeat-refusal comment, calls for action from religious bodies
text: The National Democratic Congress in Awutu Senya East has condemned comments by incumbent MP Mavis Hawa Koomson to the effect that she will only accept defeat in the 2024 general elections when she is dead. According to the NDC, the comments are an affront to the democratic process adding that the incumbent MP must be ready to accept defeat if she loses the seat to the NDC’s Naa Koryoo Okunnor. The leadership of the NDC in the constituency added that they will ensure that the happenings of the 2020 election where there were gunshots at certain centres are not repeated. The party has also questioned the religious bodies in the Awutu Senya East constituency for failing to condemn the comments of Hawa Koomson. “The actions and inaction of the clergy, and religious bodies within Awutu Senya East are contributing more to the menace caused by Hawa. Everyone here belongs to either a church or a mosque. We are the same youth that helps build the church. “We are the same youth that raises money when the church needs funds. It is the same church and mosque that Hawa and her people will walk into for prayers, prayers to win an election and come and beat us. And our men of God, our clergymen, our Imams are quiet. how many of us should die before you know that this woman is killing the youth?”

author: Margherita De Bac
title: ¿Cuál es el estado del papa Francisco? ¿Qué temen ahora los médicos?
text:
¿Cuál es el estado del Papa Francisco?
Los médicos que le siguen están muy preocupados, quizá más que durante sus anteriores hospitalizaciones. Su estado se describe como "estable" dentro de un marco muy crítico. No es una buena señal. Puede significar que las terapias administradas, a base de antibióticos y antifúngicos, utilizados contra las infecciones bacterianas y fúngicas (hongos), no han dado lugar hasta ahora a mejoras significativas. Tiene graves dificultades respiratorias y "lucha" contra agentes infecciosos que se han aprovechado de un organismo que sufre una grave inmunodepresión hasta el punto de provocarle una neumonía bilateral.
¿Qué es la inmunodepresión?
Es un estado de debilidad en el que la funcionalidad de nuestro sistema inmunitario, destinado a luchar contra las infecciones, está mermada. En esta condición es más difícil defendernos, especialmente en la vejez, de los microorganismos ambientales causantes de enfermedades, como virus, bacterias y hongos.
¿Qué revelaron los análisis realizados al material de las vías respiratorias?
Los resultados llegaron ya el viernes por la tarde. Se identificó la presencia de varios microorganismos. Y, efectivamente, el boletín médico habla de una infección polimicrobiana, es decir, de la presencia simultánea de varios microbios patógenos en las vías respiratorias. Además de bacterias y virus, también se han detectado hongos. Estos últimos son la causa de las denominadas infecciones oportunistas, ya que se desarrollan principalmente en individuos inmunodeprimidos.
¿Existe peligro de complicaciones posteriores?
Sí. Las infecciones pueden afectar a la función de los órganos. La neumonía bilateral suele ser la complicación más temida. El Papa ya ha sufrido una neumonía. Este es su punto débil, ya que fue operado de un lóbulo pulmonar en los años 80. Desde hace tiempo se le trata con medicamentos a base de cortisona, que se utilizan para reducir la inflamación de las vías respiratorias que padece. El boletín médico del martes por la noche habla de "bronquiectasias asmatiformes", es decir, con un componente asmático. Durante las últimas audiencias y actos públicos, el Papa respiró con dificultad y tuvo que dejar de leer. El frío no le ayudaba.
¿Qué temen ahora los médicos?
El peligro más temido es la sepsis, el paso de microorganismos en la sangre que se propagan a otros órganos, con consecuencias muy graves.
¿Qué es la neumonía bilateral?
Es una enfermedad frecuente, sobre todo durante los meses de invierno, que puede dar lugar a complicaciones graves, aunque suele curarse principalmente con antibióticos. Consiste en la inflamación del tejido de ambos pulmones. Los alvéolos pulmonares, que permiten la oxigenación, se inflaman e impiden esta función. Suele estar causada por una infección bacteriana, pero también puede deberse a una infección vírica o fúngica o a la aspiración de un cuerpo extraño.
¿Quiénes son sus médicos?
Es seguido por especialistas de la Fundación Gemelli, en función de la evolución de su estado. Se ha solicitado la consulta de un anestesista. Muy pocos tienen acceso a su piso.

author: Società Editrice Athesis S.p.A.
title: Ghf, 'attaccati da Hamas, uccisi 5 nostri operatori umanitari' | Bresciaoggi
text: WASHINGTON, 12 GIU - La Gaza Humanitarian Foundation, organizzazione privata sostenuta dagli Stati Uniti e attiva nella Striscia di Gaza, accusa Hamas di aver attaccato un autobus che trasportava i suoi operatori umanitari, causando almeno cinque morti e numerosi feriti. Lo ha reso noto la stessa fondazione in un comunicato. L'attacco sarebbe avvenuto intorno alle 22:00 ora locale di ieri, mentre il mezzo si dirigeva verso un centro di distribuzione di aiuti nell'area ovest di Khan Younis. A bordo c'erano oltre venti membri del team, tutti cittadini palestinesi impiegati come operatori umanitari. "Condanniamo con la massima fermezza questo attacco brutale e deliberato - si legge nella nota -. Queste erano persone che rischiavano la propria vita ogni giorno per aiutare gli altri: padri, fratelli, figli e amici." La Ghf ha aggiunto che alcune delle persone a bordo potrebbero essere state prese in ostaggio, anche se al momento le informazioni restano frammentarie. Attiva dal 26 maggio, dopo oltre due mesi di completo blocco degli aiuti da parte israeliana, la fondazione ha dichiarato di aver già distribuito oltre sette milioni di pasti..

author: Flyover Conservatives
title: How can YOU Pray Prophetically? | Prophetic Prayer Training with Stacy Whited and Ginger Ziegler
text:
“When we start embracing God’s grace, God comes with His abundance of power and ability and He begins to change us. He begins to change our way of thinking in a permanent way. God uses His power, His loving-kindness, to take the truth and set us free.” - Ginger Ziegler Ginger Ziegler is an accomplished author, teacher, mentor, grandmother, mother, and confidant. She is affectionately known as “Mom” to those who know her personally. In her 40+ years of ministry, she has established and pastored churches, Bible schools, ministry training schools, foreign missions, prison ministries and prayer groups all over the world. Additionally, she has preached in numerous churches in the U.S. and many foreign countries. She has also worked with many large ministries, establishing Biblically sound and healthy prayer groups, and leadership schools. Ginger has a passion for empowering individuals to live out their God-given purpose and fulfill God’s original design for their lives, reigning victoriously as sons and daughters, equipped with the revelation of the POWER that is in the Name and Blood of Jesus. author: EFE
title: La Justicia ratifica que llamar "gilipollas" a un jefe no es motivo de despido - Faro de Vigo
text: El Tribunal Superior de Justicia de Madrid (TSJM) ha ratificado que llamar \"gilipollas\" a un superior no es motivo de despido disciplinario, siempre que se trate de un insulto \"concreto y aislado\" en un contexto determinado, como el caso de un empleado al que le pidieron que se quedara a una reunión tras su turno cuando tenía prisa por motivos personales. La Sección Primera de lo Social del TSJM, en una sentencia dictada en enero a la que ha tenido acceso EFE, desestima el recurso de súplica interpuesto por la una empresa contra la sentencia del Juzgado de lo Social 31 de Madrid que consideró que el despido de un trabajador que insultó así a un responsable no fue procedente. Esa sentencia, ahora confirmada, estimó la demanda del trabajador, declaró improcedente su despido y condenó a la empresa a la inmediata readmisión del empleado, o bien a indemnizarle con 23.541 euros netos. En caso de readmisión se le deberían pagar los salarios no abonados desde el despido, en abril de 2023. Ahora los magistrados consideran probado que el empleado trabajaba en la empresa desde 2008 como auxiliar de fábrica y el 24 de abril de 2023 la empresa le notificó su despido por ofensas verbales al empresario, ya que tres días antes fue convocado a una reunión con otros trabajadores, a las 14:55 horas, y el empleado dijo que se marchaba porque acababa su jornada laboral. La administradora le advirtió de que si se marchaba podía ser sancionado por desobediencia, teniendo en cuenta que ya había disfrutado de 15 minutos de descanso, y entonces el trabajador le dijo \"a ver si te atreves, gilipollas\", y se marchó dando un portazo. Queda probado que el trabajador, que ya había sido sancionado en otras ocasiones y que acaba su turno a las 15:00 horas, tenía prisa por motivos personales. Los magistrados rechazan los argumentos de la empresa sobre la gravedad de la conducta del trabajado y ratifican que, como decía la sentencia originaria, \"tal insulto realizado por el trabajador y dirigido a la administradora constituye una clara ofensa verbal\", pero se trata de \"un hecho aislado\" y \"concreto\". La sala de lo Social argumenta que \"hay que valorar el contexto en que se produjeron los hechos, así como las circunstancias objetivas y subjetivas concurrentes, entre los que resalta que cuando se exige al trabajador su presencia en las instalaciones de la empresa ya había terminado su jornada de trabajo y tenía prisa por motivos personales\". \"Aunque cuando la contestación del actor y las formas empleadas al dirigirse a la administradora fueron destempladas, desabridas y malsonantes (...), marchándose dando un portazo, no tienen la gravedad y el componente de culpabilidad necesario como para justificar su despido\", concluyen.

author: PETER SEGALL psegall@bakersfield.com
title: Creatures stirring: Bakersfield enjoys quiet day after Christmas | News | bakersfield.com
text:
The day after Christmas was quiet around Bakersfield as families with the day off headed out to take advantage of the sun and the extended vacation.
It was uncharacteristically busy Thursday morning at the Park at River Walk, but with kids still out of school and many parents taking time away from work, dozens of people walked, biked, fished or simply laid out in the sun after a busy Christmas Day.

author: ANI
title: India News | Delhi Airport Issues Advisory for Non CAT III Compliant Flights
text:
New Delhi [India], January 3 (ANI): Amid the prevailing dense fog conditions, Delhi airport authorities on Friday issued an advisory and stated that flights which were not CAT III compliant would get affected.
Taking to social media X, the authority wrote in a post "While landing and take offs continue at Delhi airport, flights that are not CAT III compliant may get affected."
Also Read | Stocks To Buy or Sell Today, January 3, 2025: NHPC, Biocon and Varun Beverages Among Shares Expected To Remain in Focus on Friday.
Further, the airport authorities requested passengers to contact concerned airlines for their updated flight information.
"Passengers are requested to contact the airline concerned for updated flight information," the post further read.
Also Read | 'Love Jihad': Supreme Court Declines To Entertain PIL To Expunge Trial Court's Remarks, Saying 'Illegal Conversion Threat to Unity, Integrity and Sovereignty of Country'.
Inconveniences caused to passengers were regretted.
"Any inconvenience caused is deeply regretted," the post further read.
Meanwhile, the city recorded a minimum temperature of 9.6 degrees Celsius at 5:30 a.m. as per the Indian Meteorological Department.
AQI in the city was recorded as 348 in the 'very poor' category.
An AQI between zero and 50 is considered 'good,' 51 and 100 'satisfactory,' 101 and 200 'moderate,' 201 and 300 'poor,' 301 and 400 'very poor,' and 401 and 500 'severe.'
Homeless people took shelter in the night shelters as the temperature continued to dip in the national capital.
The Delhi Urban Shelter Improvement Board (DUSIB) has also set up 235 pagoda tents to provide shelter to homeless people. Night shelters have been set up in several areas of the national capital, including AIIMS, Lodhi Road, and Nizamuddin flyover.
In response to the chilly weather, residents of the capital were seen gathering around bonfires, while others took shelter in night homes as temperatures continued to drop.
Other northern states of the country continued to face the harsh winter conditions.
Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow recorded a minimum temperature of 8 degrees Celsius at 3:30 a.m.
Temporary shelter homes have been set up by the local administration for the homeless people.
In Jammu and Kashmir's capital Srinagar, the temperature recorded was -1.3 degrees Celsius at 5.30 am. (ANI)
(This is an unedited and auto-generated story from Syndicated News feed, LatestLY Staff may not have modified or edited the content body)
